No more probesets will be processed, this is a chance to finish outputting results and clean up.

bool QuantMethodExprCCCHPReport::prepare ( QuantMethod &  qMethod,
const IntensityMart &  iMart 
) [virtual]

Get set up for a run of reporting probesets.

Often used to open file streams and print headers to files etc.

Parameters:
qMethod - Quantification method to be used.
layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
Returns:
true if success, false otherwise.

bool QuantMethodExprCCCHPReport::report ( ProbeSetGroup &  psGroup,
QuantMethod &  qMethod,
const IntensityMart &  iMart,
std::vector< ChipStream * > &  iTrans,
PmAdjuster &  pmAdjust 
) [virtual]

After every probeset computation this function is called an is an opportunity to query the quantification method for results, residuals, etc.

Parameters:
psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
Returns:
true if success, false otherwise.

Implements QuantMethodReport.

bool QuantMethodExprCCCHPReport::reportFailure ( ProbeSetGroup &  psGroup,
QuantMethod &  qMethod,
const IntensityMart &  iMart,
std::vector< ChipStream * > &  iTrans,
PmAdjuster &  pmAdjust 
) [virtual]

If a probeset fails to compute for whatever reason then this method is called rather than the normal report call above.

By default does nothing.

Parameters:
psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
Returns:
true if success, false otherwise.

Reimplemented from QuantMethodReport.

void QuantMethodExprCCCHPReport::setChpFileNames ( std::vector< std::string > &  fileNames  ) 

Set the CHP filenames to use for output.

This overrides any prefix and allows the caller to place the chp files anyplace they are desired.

Parameters:
fileNames - Vector of fileNames with full path to output file, one for each cel file.
